properties.name: Spherez
properties.description:
Shoot the blocks before they touch the ground.  Earn extra balls and destroy the blocks by aiming carefully.

This is a game template made with GDevelop, a no-code open-source game engine.
properties.author: GDevelop

events.comment: Start timer so that ball shooting can start

events.name: Pick a random color for each block (which is based on the BlockStrength value)

events.comment: No balls left, prepare for next shot
Delete balls when they touch the bottom

objects.name: Block_Tutorial_Text
objects.string: Destroy all blocks before they touch the ground

objects.name: Block_Tutorial_Text
objects.string: Destroy all blocks before they touch the ground

events.comment: Hide UI elements that are not meant to be seen at the start
Set initial values of variables.  Editing these values is one way to customize the behavior of the game.
Read the saved highscore from storage
Start the shooting timer so it will be ready when the player wants to shoot
Pick the number of blocks to create
Pick a random block generator and increase the strength based on the current level (some might be picked more than once and will get extra strength)
Create blocks based on strength of generator
Create text to show inside of the block
Add powerups on block generators with no blocks (based on a random chance)
Create powerup to show inside of the block
Create powerup to show inside of the block
Blocks start with outline disabled (it is activated when a ball hits a block)
If a block has hit the bottom, go to "GameOver" instead
Save the direction the ball will be shot
Create aiming balls to visualize the direction the balls will go
Place aiming balls in a line
Delete balls when they touch the bottom
Use "Wait" so the brick breaking sound can finish before starting the extra ball sound effect
Sound plays three times and each time is higher pitch
Rotate to prevent horizontal balls that take forever to fall down
Increment the angle after each loop.  This will cause the balls to spread out in a 360 range.
Slide ball to new starting position
If new highscore was reached, save it to storage
Create a new row of blocks

events.name: Verify score was saved to Leaderboard
Debugging and Testing (enable this to become active)

events.comment: Change pause to the opposite state (on/off)
Save the previous game state so it can be returned to when Pause is over
Cover existing game with semi-transparent black

events.name: Hide buttons that are not used in Pause Menu

events.comment: Go back to title screen and unpause

events.name: Unhide buttons that were disabled during pause

events.comment: Return to the previous game state
Start with no tint and no outline
Use the same sound effect as blocks but play it twice as fast
Darken button when it is being pressed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
- Hovered
- Pressed
- Clicked
- Idle
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
- Size
- Color
- Animation
- Object effects

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Westboy31
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FlashTransitionPainter
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behavior for shape painter allows you to paint a color all over the screen for period of time with an effect (useful for simulate flash and transition effect).
description: * __Paint effect:__Action to paint a color all over the screen for a period of time with specific effect.
effect type:
* __Flash:__ is a monochrome color appear with fade then disappear with fade out.
* __Vertical:__ is a monochrome color comes from right side then comes back.
* __Horizontal:__ is a monochrome color come from top side then comes back.
* __Circular:__ is a circle which increases from the center and narrows.
* __Paint effect ended:__ event when the paint effect ends.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Paint all over the screen a color for a period of time.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FlashTransitionPainter

events.comment: Disable effect when the game starts.
Avoid default parameter of painter that could make the extension doesn't work.

Initialise position of painter. 
Increment or decrement "_TimeProgressionEffect" depending on direction.

Here this the paints functions of different effect depending on the type chosen by the user.
Detect the direction of the animation and its end.
Type 2 : screen come from top then return.
Type 3 : screen come from left then return.
Type 4 : a circle scale up from the middle then scale down.
The repeat 5 times is used to have clean and smooth edges , especially for circle.

eventsFunctions.description: Paint Effect.
eventsFunctions.name: PaintEffect
eventsFunctions.sentence: Paint effect type _PARAM4_ of _PARAM0_ with direction _PARAM5_ and color _PARAM2_ for _PARAM3_ seconds

events.comment:
Initialise all variables and then activate the behavior.
If user doesn't assign value to color and type , we take the last value registred.
If user doesn't assign value to timer we take a default value (0.2).

eventsFunctions.description: Paint effect ended.
eventsFunctions.name: PaintEffectIsEnd

events.comment: Detect when the animation ends with a timer which is initialised in PaintEffect function.

propertyDescriptors.label: The maximum of the opacity only for flash
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxOpacity

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CopyCameraSettings
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Copy the camera settings of a layer and apply them to another layer.
description: Useful when multiple layers need to use the same camera values.
How to use:
- Run the "Copy camera settings" action after all other camera actions have been performed
Tips:
- Do not use on layers that implement a parallax effect

eventsFunctions.description: Copy camera settings of a layer and apply them to another layer.
eventsFunctions.name: CopyCameraSettings
eventsFunctions.sentence: Copy camera settings of _PARAM1_ layer and apply them to _PARAM3_ layer (X position: _PARAM5_, Y position: _PARAM6_, Zoom: _PARAM7_,  Angle: _PARAM8_)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale).
description: Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position: Shake the X and/or Y position of the object
- Angle: Shake the angle (rotation) of the object
- Scale: Shake the scale of the object (must be a sprite)
Control how the object shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the object moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the object
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each movement of the object
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)
Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Object is not shaking"
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy31, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake the camera on the specified layer using one or more methods of shaking (position, angle, zoom).
description: Ideal for explosions, hit/impacts, earthquake, etc.
Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position:  Shake the X and/or Y position of the camera
- Angle: Shake the rotation of the camera
- Zoom: Shake the zoom level of the camera
Control how the camera shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the camera moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the camera
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each change of the movement of the camera
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)
Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Camera is not shaking"
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing

eventsFunctions.description: Shake the camera on the specified layer, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, zoom).
eventsFunctions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake camera on _PARAM3_ layer for _PARAM5_ seconds. Use an amplitude of _PARAM1_px on X axis and _PARAM2_px on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM6_ degrees, and zoom amplitude _PARAM7_ percent.  Wait _PARAM8_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM9_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the X axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the Y axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Every "odd" shake, rotate clockwise (this includes the initial shake and can be used for a one shake effect)
Calculate camera zoom displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached or if stop shaking has been requested

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.
description: Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
After adding this to an object, you have to **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Flash

eventsFunctions.description: Make the specified object(s) blink for the given duration.
eventsFunctions.name: Flash

parameters.description: Duration of the blinking, in seconds
parameters.name: FlashDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified objects are flashing.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFlashing

eventsFunctions.description: Stop the flashing of the specified object.
eventsFunctions.name: Stop

propertyDescriptors.label: Half period (time during which object is invisible), in seconds
propertyDescriptors.name: HalfPeriodTime

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behavior to stick objects to other objects - so that they follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.
description: This extension can be useful for:
* Stick an accessory to a moving object,
* Animate a skeleton.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is stuck to another object.
eventsFunctions.name: IsStuck

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Stick the object to another. Use the action to stick the object, or unstick it later.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Sticker

inlineCode: // Set up the scene sticker objects list - if not done already.
// Set up the behavior extra methods - if not done already.
* Update the coordinates in the basisObject basis.
* It uses the basisObject coordinates from the previous frame.
* This way, the sticker can move relatively to it and still
// Save initial values to avoid calculus and rounding errors
* Copy the coordinates to use it the next frame.
* This method is also called by children to ensure
// If the behavior on the basis object has a different name,
// the objects will still follow their basis objects
// Follow parents 1st to avoid frame delays
object.setX(basisObject.getCenterXInScene() + object.getX() - object.getCenterXInScene() + deltaX * Math.cos(angle) + deltaY * Math.sin(angle));
object.setY(basisObject.getCenterYInScene() + object.getY() - object.getCenterYInScene() - deltaX * Math.sin(angle) + deltaY * Math.cos(angle));
// Unproportional dimensions changes won't work as expected
// if the object angle is not null but nothing more can be done
// because there is no full affine transformation on objects.
// Register this object as a sticker.

eventsFunctions.description: Stick on another object.
eventsFunctions.name: Stick

eventsFunctions.description: Unstick from the object it was stuck to.
eventsFunctions.name: Unstick
